result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kimberly A McFarland

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
DEOJ Agreement

Clerk: Amy. 
Called:  10:16 a.m. 
INCLUDES 19CM2145, 20CF1086, 21CF1618, 22CF720.
State appears by ADA Lacey Coonen. 
Defendant appears in custody from MCJ with Atty Thomas Roley. 

Date and time set for plea/sentencing hearing in all cases and waiver of prelim in 21CF1618; VRCW.  

WAIVER OF PRELIMINARY HEARING>>>
Waiver of Prelim. filed; COURT questions deft as to waiver.
COURT finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial. 
Information will be e-filed.  

PLEA/SENTENCING HEARING>>>
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

21CF1618>>>State moves to DRI: 
Count 1 (Bail Jumping-Felony); COURT grants. 
Count 4 (Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor); COURT grants. 

22CF720>>State moves to DRI: 
Count 1 (Bail Jumping-Felony); COURT grants.
Count 2 (Bail Jumping-Felony); COURT grants.
Count 3 (Bail Jumping-Felony); COURT grants.
Count 5 (Possession of THC); COURT grants. 
Count 6 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia); COURT grants.  

PLEA/SENTENCING: 

19CM2145>>Count 1 (Retail Theft-Intentionally Take <=$500): GUILTY.  

20CF1086>>Count 1 (Maintain Drug Trafficking Place/PTAC): GUILTY.  

21CF1618>>Count 2 (Credit Card-Fraudulent Use <=$2500): GUILTY.  
21CF1618>>Count 3 (Resisting or Obstructing an Officer): GUILTY.  

22CF720>>Count 4 (Maintain Drug Trafficking Place/PTAC):  GUILTY.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS on 19CM2145 and 21CF1618: SWH for 2 years probation; concurrent with each other.  
CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  AODA and follow up.  Maintain FTW/School/treatment or combination of at least 30 hours per week, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours CS per week. Maintain absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol/controlled substances unless valid prescription and taken only as prescribed.  No possession of drug paraphernalia. Court costs including DNA sample/surcharge.  Restitution if requested, including 10% surcharge.   

20CF1086 and 22CF720>>>COURT w/holds finding and entry of guilt.  COURT adopts written deferred entry of judgment agreement as signed by all parties and submitted to COURT.  COURT defers both counts for a period of 2 years for defendant to comply with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement.
If defendant is in full compliance with all terms and conditions of written DEOJ agreement within that time frame and obtains no new criminal charges, State to DISMISS both counts.   COURT grants 59 days credit in 22CF720, if revoked.  

DEOJ RH>> 8/06/2024 at 9:00 a.m. 

Adj:  10:40 a.m.
Ltr from Defendant regarding bond modification.

$2,500 signature bond with first $1,000 in cash.  No contact with co-defendants: Glenn Reed, Manuel Williams and Vonzell Williams.  Police escort to retrieve personal property from the residence. Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction.

CONDITIONS:

- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except valid prescriptions taken as prescribed.  
- No possession of drug paraphernalia. 
- Prints and photograph. 
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 3 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
